page.title: 01Montgomery Area Mid Wales
page.content: Part of Montgomery area, central Powys Mid Wales. This area covers the upper part of the severn valley, less than 10 miles from its source. The river winds its way through the grid and is flanked on either side by soft rolling hills, the highest point being 800 ft In the south is the village of Llandinam which consists of about 300 inhabitants, the majority of whom works in shops, offices and factories in the neighbouring towns of Llanidloes and Newtown. Around the village are several large farms and some small holdings, the owners of which have a full time job as well. Farming is mixed and while the pasture land on side of the river suports mainly freisian cattle, Suffolk cross and welsh half bred sheep, the grassy uplands are ideally suited to the hardier welsh speckled faced sheep
